Posts.Content: Aug 17, 2013 03:02AM Elsie0203 wrote: Hi Alicki Have just read your other posts and can see you are and have been going through the same experience with very similar symptoms.  It's worrying though that you have been waiting all this time for answers as I see you joined the forum in June.  Why is everything so slow with the NHS? When I found a suspicious mass a year or so ago I received an appointment to attend Derriford Hospital in Plymouth within the week.  I was impressed but I have been told not to expect such a rapid response this time probably because of NHS cuts.  I had a mammogram and think I had an ultra sound as well which showed nothing abnormal.  I did however have a CT scan a few months ago when I started having chest pains (could this have been the start?) and my consultant did  advise that there was a 'slightly increased risk' of developing breast cancer from the radiation.  I was more concerned about potential heart problems at the time.  So stupid. Anyway I will look out for your posts.  My symptoms seem to be very similar to yours at the moment - though swelling always seems to go down a bit overnight.  I can feel a small lump under my left nipple which wasn't there before.  I too have taken loads of photos with my mobile phone and the pics seem to show up shadows under the skin that aren't obvious to the naked eye.  I'm just frightening myself even more I know. Take care and good luck.
Posts.Title: getting worried now faerie1111 faerie1111

Posts.Content: Aug 17, 2013 03:25PM Elsie0203 wrote: I am experiencing exactly the same breast changes faerie1111- weird.  A sort of let-down feeling as when breastfeeding then breast becomes red and engorged.  Other times in the day the red fades and the breast feels almost normal and I allow myself to believe I am imagining it all.  Worrying thing is that the nipple on breast that is least effected, the right is now inverting even more and I noticed a tiny amount of discharge - not sure if bloody but looked greasy.  The nipple inverted initially when I had a mild mastitis 22 years ago. and its got worse.  Can't think of anything else at the moment and hugging the lap top to me looking up symptoms and stuff. Just feel sick and can't sleep.  Horrible.
Posts.Title: getting worried now faerie1111 faerie1111

Posts.Content: Aug 19, 2013 02:11PM Elsie0203 wrote: I was just about to post that I had not seen anything from you faerie when clicked on this and saw your good news.  Am so happy for you.  What a relief.  Fingers crossed for the other results. I hope mine turn out the same. I've found a couple of lumps, one behind my left nipple  and another to the side of of my left breast plus some some lumpiness that wasn't there before.  But like you Alicki I've lost so much weight my breasts feel different anyway.  All I can stomach is fruit and water. Rash has gone right down and so has swelling but still painful lymph nodes on rib cage and now groin as well as armpits. Did either of you experience same problem with the lymph nodes?

Posts.Content: Aug 21, 2013 05:04AM Elsie0203 wrote: Hi faeri.  Am going back to GP as lymph nodes still up so something going on and feel generally unwell.  Am going to get checked for diabetes as this can lead to breast pain. I'm worried that the mammogram didn't pick up everything and feel I should have insisted on a scan.  There is still no explanation why my breasts swelled up like they did though they feel normal now.  This has been one of the worst weeks of my life but talking to you lovely ladies has got me through it.  Heartfelt thanks xx

Posts.Content: Aug 18, 2013 07:49AM Elsie0203 wrote: Good luck for tomorrow.  I really hope it is good news and will be thinking of you. My GP prescribed sleeping tablets and I actually managed to get a reasonable nights sleep for the first time since Thursday.  Also managed to eat some breakfast. Have lost a lot of weight just with the worry - no weight loss before this began - so my boobs seem more floppy and soft; I can't feel any hardened masses at the moment, rash is still pink but not inflamed.  Found some painful lymph nodes on my ride cage and my arm still feels odd but no longer swollen.  Very strange.

Posts.Content: Aug 17, 2013 06:24AM - edited Aug 17, 2013 06:25AM by Elsie0203 Just got my appointment for 28th August!! Too long to wait so will call them on Monday and see if I an get it moved forward.  My left breast, where this started is getting bigger and redder; nipple has started to invert (never had this before so clearly swelling is getting worse) Skin is looking mottled. The right breast in contrast seems more settled.  This is so crazy.  I think once I know and treatment starts I can get on with my life bizarre as that sounds.  It will be a different life though. Are you from the UK originally as I noticed you looking to get treatment in the UK.  I looked up Royal Marsden but I am at the bottom of the country though moving back to Wiltshire in few weeks.  Will ask the oncologist if I can be referred.
Posts.Title: getting worried now faerie1111 faerie1111

Posts.Content: Aug 21, 2013 02:22PM Elsie0203 wrote: I would call the GP tomorrow and have a telephone consultation if you don't want to make a face to face appointment. He/she might be able to reassure you.  If you have an infection lymph nodes can pop up all over the place  I found some on my rib cage which have gone down now.  They can also come up if you are run down and stressed which you are.  I've been looking up disorders of the lympathic system and there are conditons like cellulitis which cause rash and bacterial infections that can affect the breast through entering the skin via small cuts and spots.  I found some spots where the band of my bra sits and wondered if bacteria could have got through via those.  My partner is a chef and twice now he has had extreme inflammation to the hands where bacteria has got in via cuts and has needed antibiotics. Once his hand swelled up massively.  Another thing is if you haven't done so already ask your GP for a thyroid check.  Under active thyroid plays havoc with hormones.  I'm sure it will be fine but I understand what you are going through.  You are not wasting your time trying to get answers  Take care xx
Posts.Title: getting worried now faerie1111 faerie1111

Posts.Content: Aug 22, 2013 06:35AM Elsie0203 wrote: Hi faerie and Alicki Hope you are both holdig up ok.  My symptoms seem to have eased - breasts  no longer swollen but rash still present though not as red.  Lymph nodes still up under arm and still have burning sensation radiating from under arm along the side of the breast.  Have completed course of anti-biotics so perhaps they have worked.  Faerie if your symptoms are worsening you must go back to the breast clinic - bypass the GP.  You are already in the system.  They need to see that things are progressing.  Good luck.  Will be thinking of you x
